titleInfo.title: Weapons and display at the Clarksville Armory manuevers

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
mods.abstract: Outside the Clarksville Armory a crowd is pictured gathered around Tennessee State Guard soldiers who are giving a talk on weaponry. Displayed on a blanket on the ground in front of them are a variety of rifles and gas canisters. One Guard member is holding a grenade launcher as he addresses the crowd. Spectators include Brigadier General Jacob McGavock Dickinson, State Guard members, and civilians.

The Tennessee State Guard military program that took place at the Clarksville Armory on September 10, 1944 featured inspections, reviews, a riot control demonstration, a chemical demonstration, and drills. On the reviewing stands were Brig. Gen. J.M.; Dickinson, brigade commander; Col. R.A. Bailey, assistant adjutant general; Col. Millard F. Waltz, senior instructor; and Lt. H.S. Murphy, brigade adjutant.
